Test Name: Mycobacterium Tuberculosis Complex, Pyrazinamide Resistance by pncA DNA Sequencing
Specimen Type: Clinical specimens (e.g., sputum or cultured isolates)
Purpose: To detect pyrazinamide resistance in Mycobacterium tuberculosis complex by identifying mutations in the pncA gene through DNA sequencing.
Container: Sterile, leak-proof screw-cap container or culture tube appropriate for mycobacterial specimens
Equipment: Class II biosafety cabinet, thermal cycler, DNA sequencer, spectrophotometer (e.g., Nanodrop), centrifuge, vortex
